result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tove A. Alecksen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on August 5, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Order to Amend Condition of Bail. 
It is hereby ordered that the bail be amended as stated in the Motion to Amend Condition of Bail (Defendant shall not be on the premises of the Manitowoc Public Library).

1:44 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tove A. Alecksen in court.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski in court for Tove A. Alecksen. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  04-29-22
BAIL MOTION:
The State moves to modify the bail to include the condition that the defendant have no contact with the Manitowoc Public Library.  Court grants the motion.  State to draft the necessary order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion to Modify Condition of Bond
$2,500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-21-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is not to possess, use, or have access to any internet enabled device and defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
